Comments_List: I learned a lot about what I wanted to work in for my PhD, and it taught me the necessary techniques to do research in the field.
I learned a lot of knowledge in atomic physics which are really helpful with my research.
It is a very fast paced course, and requires consistent effort to be able to get through. However, at the end of the course, one emerges enlightened and ready with a lot of knowledge about the field.

Strength: lots of hands-on work with AMO theory.

Weakness: not every topic covered in class is also covered in the problems, which makes me likely not to learn it as well.
I really like the organization of the class. I felt I learned a lot from doing problem sets.
Yes, but only if that student were prepared to put in the required effort.
Yes, if they are working in AMO.
If you want to do AMO related research, you should definitely take the class.
